result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth C Skinner was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $3,600.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
----------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $719.61 and restitution surcharge.
----------------------------
*AMENDMENT 11/14/2019 - Pursuant to Restitution Hearing on 5/14/2015 and Order Filed, Restitution is set at zero.
-----------------------------

Must attend a Victim Impact Panel within first six (6) months of Extended Supervision.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan

218 pm case called. Appearances made. 
Anna Marie Johnson appears in person. Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger appeared.   
Atty Lettenberger requests this case be offset with personal injury case. Or that this matter be continued day to day until personal injury case is concluded. 
Court questions Ms. Johnson. Ms. Johnson is represented by an attorney in civil case but was instructed to appear today pro se. Ms. Johnson is not prepared to proceed today.

Defendant Kenneth C Skinner in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  

**02/26/2015 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz  (df)

Defendant Kenneth C Skinner in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Estee Elizabeth Scholtz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kenneth C Skinner in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea and trial reserved. Thirty days for motions. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Exhibit stored in file.

Defendant Kenneth C Skinner in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 2:08 p.m. State calls Deputy Jason Hintz who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo. State's Exhibit S-1 marked and identified (copy of complaint). Witness testifies as to complaint. State moves exhibit S-1 into evidence. Objection by attorney Lettenberger objects due to lack of admissibility of blood draw as no foundation. Objection overruled. Exhibit received. 
2:12 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Lettenberger. 
2:14 p.m. - Redirect by ADA Donohoo
2:15 p.m. - Recross by Attorney Lettenberger
2:15 p.m. - Witness excused and State Rests. Defense has no witnesses or evidence. Evidence closed.
2:16 p.m. - Argument by Attorney Lettenberger
2:18 p.m. - Argument by ADA Donohoo
Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. State files Information - reading waived. 
Court in recess @ 2:21 p.m.
Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Signed bond filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH ANNAMARIE JOHNSON.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
